TextView.android:text: Turkish Fasulye (White Beans) Ingredients: 2 cups dried white beans 2 tbsp olive oil 1 onion, finely chopped 2 cloves of garlic, minced 2 medium-sized tomatoes, diced 1 tbsp tomato paste 1 tsp paprika 1 tsp salt (adjust to taste) 1/2 tsp ground black pepper 4 cups water (or vegetable broth) Fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish) Instructions: Soak the dried white beans overnight or use the quick-soak method. Drain and rinse the soaked beans. Heat olive oil in a pot and sautÃ© onion and garlic until translucent. Add tomatoes, tomato paste, paprika, salt, and black pepper. Cook for a few minutes until tomatoes soften. Add the drained white beans and water (or vegetable broth) to the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for about 1-2 hours until the beans are tender, stirring occasionally. Adjust seasoning if needed. Serve the fasulye hot, garnished with fresh parsley. Enjoy your Turkish Fasulye (White Beans)!
